item.description:
From http://maj.org/yamato...

"Not exactly dance, not precisely music, not solely spectacle, Japan's Yamato Drummers are a combination of all three. They fill the stage with huge, beautiful drums and beat seven bells out of them, at an unrelenting decibel level and with phenomenal skill, applying ferocity somewhere between the seriousness of samurai and the crazed exhibitionism of heavy-metal rock drummers."

Youtube video: http://www.youtube.co...

Check out the official website at http://www.yamato.jp/...

Tickets are available from :

Telecharge: 1-800/233-3123 : http://www.telecharge...
MajesTix Groups: 617/824-8000 :
Specific Needs: 617/824-8000
TTY: 1-888-889-8587
Also from http://www.artsboston...

Prices from telecharge start at around $70 -- prices from artsboston.org are $25, plus if there are any open seats left over you may buy them from a bostix booth location at half price. There is a bostix booth in Copley square and in Faneuil Hall marketplace. Bostix booths are CASH ONLY!!!!


Directions: (from http://www.maj.org/di...)

The Green Line stop is Boylston/Theatre District. When you leave the station, walk downhill to Boylston and Tremont streets, cross Boylston and continue downhill Â½ block. Look for the colorful marquee on the right.

The Orange Line stop is Essex/Chinatown. When you leave the station, walk to the front of the China Trade Center building. Keep that building on your left as you walk one block along Boylston Street. At the next corner (Boylston and Tremont), turn left onto Tremont Street. Look for the colorful marquee on the right.
